[`32304bf0d3dc6c42...`](https://drahtbot.space/guix/bitcoin/bitcoin/ad58437cd9d0c75672fda816b20c98d5c473d41d/guix_build.log.diff) |

Concept ACK

Looking at the history, the `--enable-upnp-default` has been around since the switch to autotools. Before that, when the project was still using qmake, it was possible to pass `qmake "USE_UPNP=1` to achieve the same behavior. Similar options were available with `qmake "USE_DBUS=1` and `qmake "USE_QRCODE"` (though for one reason or another these were just translated into a single `with-*` configure option) and `qmake "USE_IPV6"`, which was translated to `--disable-ipv6`. The npmp behavior seems to have just copied the existing upnp checks.

Dbus and qrencode are now handled in "special" qt configure checks, while the ipv6 option was removed in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/4115.  Control of ipv6 usage was still somewhat retained through the `onlynet` argument. Similar arguments apply to this case as well.
